plants.name: Chrysanthemum indicum
plants.description: A widely cultivated ornamental plant known for its vibrant and diverse flower colors, chrysanthemums often bloom in autumn, making them popular in gardens and floral arrangements during late fall.
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums are native to East Asia and have been cultivated in China for over 2,500 years.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub admired for its large, showy flowers which bloom in late fall to early spring, camellias are prevalent in temperate climates and are valued in gardens and parks.
plants.location: East Asia, cultivated in temperate zones of North America and Europe
plants.funFact: Camellia flowers were a favorite of Queen Victoria and were symbolic of refinement in Victorian England.

plants.name: Bougainvillea glabra
plants.description: A vibrant climbing plant known for its brilliantly colored bracts surrounding small white flowers, bougainvillea blooms year-round in tropical and subtropical climates, including November.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates, including November
plants.funFact: Bougainvillea's colorful parts are actually modified leaves called bracts, not petals.

plants.name: Kalanchoe blossfeldiana
plants.description: A succulent houseplant that produces clusters of small, long-lasting blooms, Kalanchoe is often seen blooming indoors in cooler months such as November, thriving in bright light environments.
plants.bloomingSeason: Mostly in late fall and winter
plants.location: Native to Madagascar, widely grown indoors globally
plants.funFact: Kalanchoe can propagate vegetatively from leaf or stem cuttings, making it easy to propagate at home.
